name: Great Pyramid of Giza
description: Old Kingdom pyramid of Pharaoh Khufu and the largest of the Giza complex.

name: Pyramid of Khafre
description: Second-tallest Giza pyramid distinguished by its limestone cap near the summit.

name: Pyramid of Menkaure
description: Smallest of the three main Giza pyramids, built for Pharaoh Menkaure with later casing of granite.

name: Pyramid of Djoser (Step Pyramid)
description: Early step pyramid designed by Imhotep for Pharaoh Djoser during Egypt's Third Dynasty.

name: Bent Pyramid
description: Old Kingdom pyramid whose angle changes midway up, showing an evolution in smooth-sided design.

name: Red Pyramid
description: Largest pyramid at Dahshur built for Pharaoh Sneferu, notable for its reddish limestone blocks.

name: Pyramid of the Sun
description: Massive ceremonial structure on Teotihuacan's Avenue of the Dead, aligned with the setting sun.

name: Pyramid of the Moon
description: Northern pyramid at Teotihuacan overlooking the Plaza of the Moon with layered construction phases.

name: Temple of Kukulcán (El Castillo)
description: Iconic stepped pyramid dedicated to the feathered serpent deity, famous for equinox shadow effects.

name: Bass Pro Shops Pyramid
description: Steel pyramid originally built as a sports arena, now housing retail, hotel, and observation deck.

name: Luxor Hotel Pyramid
description: Glass-clad hotel pyramid on the Las Vegas Strip featuring a bright sky beam and themed interiors.

name: Louvre Pyramid
description: Glass and metal pyramid by I. M. Pei serving as the main entrance to the Louvre Museum.

name: Meidum Pyramid
description: Early large pyramid attributed to Sneferu, showing transition from step to smooth-sided design.

name: Pyramid of Unas
description: Small Fifth Dynasty pyramid noted for its Pyramid Texts inscribed within the burial chamber.

name: Pyramid of Teti
description: Ruined pyramid of the first ruler of Egypt's Sixth Dynasty, once encased in fine limestone.

name: Black Pyramid of Amenemhat III
description: Mudbrick pyramid of Pharaoh Amenemhat III, now collapsed and darkened, with complex internal passages.

name: Pyramid of Sahure
description: Fifth Dynasty pyramid complex featuring reliefs celebrating Sahure's reign and expeditions.

name: Pyramid of Taharqa at Nuri
description: Steep-sided Nubian pyramid built for Pharaoh Taharqa, the largest at the Nuri necropolis.

name: Pyramid of Queen Amanishakheto
description: Distinctive Nubian pyramid with a decorated chapel attributed to the Kandake Amanishakheto.

name: Great Pyramid of Cholula
description: Massive earthen pyramid (Tlachihualtepetl) now crowned by Iglesia de Nuestra Señora de los Remedios.

name: Pyramid of the Niches
description: Seven-tiered Totonac pyramid distinguished by 365 recessed niches across its façades.

name: Pyramid of the Magician
description: Oval-based Maya pyramid with steep stairways and multiple construction phases tied to Uxmal legends.

name: La Danta Pyramid
description: One of the largest known Maya pyramids by volume, rising from the Preclassic city of El Mirador.

name: Calakmul Structure II
description: Towering Maya pyramid dominating Calakmul's urban core with multiple royal tombs.

name: Pyramid of Austerlitz
description: Earthen pyramid and obelisk built by French troops to honor Napoleon's victories in Europe.

name: Pyramid of Cestius
description: Sharp marble-clad tomb for Gaius Cestius inspired by Egyptomania during Rome's Augustan age.

name: Pyramid of Tirana
description: Former Enver Hoxha museum turned cultural center, featuring a distinctive low concrete pyramid form.

name: Transamerica Pyramid
description: Iconic pointed skyscraper in San Francisco's Financial District designed by William Pereira.

name: Ryugyong Hotel
description: Unfinished glass-clad pyramid skyscraper dominating Pyongyang's skyline with three-winged sides.

name: Palace of Peace and Reconciliation
description: Foster + Partners-designed glass pyramid housing a concert hall and interfaith conference spaces.

name: Walter Pyramid
description: Steel athletic arena at CSU Long Beach with striking blue exterior and precise 18-story geometry.

name: Sunway Pyramid
description: Egyptian-themed shopping mall marked by a lion-headed entrance and stepped pyramid motifs.

name: Pyramid of Userkaf
description: Ruined core and basalt temple marking the first pyramid of Egypt's Fifth Dynasty king Userkaf.

name: Pyramid of Neferirkare
description: Originally stepped and later cased pyramid built for Fifth Dynasty pharaoh Neferirkare Kakai.

name: Pyramid of Nyuserre
description: Fifth Dynasty pyramid south of Neferirkare's complex with adjoining solar temple remnants.

name: Pyramid of Senusret II
description: Middle Kingdom mudbrick pyramid with concealed entrance and intact workers' town nearby.

name: Pyramid of Senusret III
description: Ruined pyramid complex for Senusret III with subterranean galleries and royal burials.

name: Pyramid of Amenemhat I
description: Mudbrick Middle Kingdom pyramid once cased in white limestone for Dynasty 12 founder Amenemhat I.

name: Pyramid of Khendjer
description: Only royal pyramid of the 13th Dynasty king Khendjer, showing unfinished outer casing.

name: Pyramid of Ameny Qemau
description: Collapsed pyramid attributed to obscure 13th Dynasty ruler Ameny Qemau with double burial chambers.

name: Pyramid of Ibi
description: Small, heavily ruined pyramid for Eighth Dynasty pharaoh Ibi in the South Saqqara necropolis.

name: Pyramid of Ahmose
description: Mudbrick ceremonial pyramid built by Ahmose I near the temple of his grandmother Tetisheri.

name: Pyramid of Amanitore
description: Steep-sided Nubian pyramid in the North Cemetery linked to Kandake Amanitore's reign.

name: Pyramid of King Piye
description: Earliest royal pyramid of the 25th Dynasty conqueror Piye overlooking the Nile's Fourth Cataract.

name: Pyramid of King Nastasen
description: Compact Nubian pyramid at Nuri belonging to King Nastasen with decorated funerary chapel remains.

name: Temple I (Temple of the Great Jaguar)
description: Classic Maya stepped pyramid-tomb of Jasaw Chan K'awiil I rising above Tikal's Great Plaza.

name: Temple II (Temple of the Masks)
description: Twin pyramid facing Temple I with carved masks and sweeping views over the Tikal rainforest canopy.

name: Temple of the Inscriptions
description: Maya funerary pyramid for Pakal the Great featuring hieroglyphic panels and a vaulted tomb chamber.

name: Nohoch Mul Pyramid
description: Tallest known pyramid in the Yucatán Peninsula, climbed via steep limestone steps at Cobá.

name: Pyramid of the Feathered Serpent
description: Six-level pyramid adorned with carved serpent heads along Teotihuacan's Avenue of the Dead.

name: Monk's Mound
description: Massive earthen platform mound forming the core pyramid at the Mississippian city of Cahokia.

name: Huaca del Sol
description: Layered adobe pyramid by the Moche civilization built from millions of bricks along the Moche River.

name: Pyramid of Pepi I
description: Old Kingdom pyramid of Pharaoh Pepi I with a ruined core and decorated burial chambers at Saqqara.

name: Pyramid of Pepi II
description: Late Old Kingdom pyramid built for Pharaoh Pepi II, notable for its long reign inscriptions and now-collapsed casing.

name: Pyramid of Merenre
description: Ruined Sixth Dynasty pyramid of Pharaoh Merenre Nemtyemsaf I with exposed rubble core near Pepi I's complex.

name: Pyramid of Djedkare Isesi
description: Pyramid of Fifth Dynasty Pharaoh Djedkare with satellite structures and an eroded limestone casing.

name: Pyramid of Djedefre
description: Remains of Pharaoh Djedefre's pyramid at Abu Rawash, once clad in granite and positioned on a high desert ridge.

name: Buried Pyramid of Sekhemkhet
description: Unfinished stepped pyramid of Pharaoh Sekhemkhet, largely buried in sand beside Djoser's complex.

name: Pyramid of King Shabaka
description: Large Napatan pyramid built for King Shabaka at Nuri with steep sides typical of Kushite royal burials.

name: Pyramid of King Aspelta
description: Kushite royal pyramid of King Aspelta at Nuri, accompanied by a subterranean burial chamber and chapel remains.

name: Pyramid of King Arkamani
description: Pyramid attributed to King Arkamani in the northern cemetery of Meroë with steep walls and decorative reliefs.

name: Pyramid of Queen Shanakdakhete
description: Steep-sided pyramid of Queen Shanakdakhete featuring a decorated chapel and hieroglyphic inscriptions at Meroë.

name: Temple IV, Tikal
description: Tallest pyramid at Tikal, built by Yik'in Chan K'awiil with a summit temple rising above the rainforest canopy.

name: High Temple, Lamanai
description: Limestone pyramid at Lamanai featuring carved masks and commanding views over the New River Lagoon.

name: Temple of the Seven Dolls
description: Small Maya pyramid aligned to the equinox sunrise, named for figurines found within the temple chamber.

name: Temple of the Five Stories
description: Tiered pyramid-palace at Edzná with five stacked stories and a stairway leading to a temple sanctuary.

name: Great Pyramid of La Venta
description: Earthen pyramid core built by the Olmec at La Venta, once a prominent cone-shaped mound dominating the site.

name: Huaca de la Luna
description: Moche adobe pyramid adorned with polychrome friezes and ceremonial plazas opposite Huaca del Sol.

name: Huaca Cao Viejo
description: Adobe pyramid at the El Brujo complex notable for the Lady of Cao burial and vivid Moche murals.

name: Huaca del Dragón
description: Chimu adobe pyramid also known as Huaca Arco Iris, decorated with reliefs of rainbows and anthropomorphic figures.

name: Pyramids of Güímar
description: Series of stepped lava-stone pyramids whose 19th-century agricultural origins remain debated on Tenerife.

name: Muttart Conservatory Pyramids
description: Four glass pyramids housing botanical biomes in Edmonton's river valley, designed by architect Peter Hemingway.

name: Templo Mayor (Great Pyramid of Tenochtitlan)
description: Twin-staired Aztec pyramid rebuilt multiple times, crowned by shrines to Tlaloc and Huitzilopochtli at the heart of Tenochtitlan.

name: Feathered Serpent Pyramid, Teotihuacan
description: Early Teotihuacan pyramid decorated with serpent and shell reliefs, fronting the Ciudadela complex.

name: Pyramid B at Tula
description: Step pyramid bearing the famous atlantean warrior columns that once supported its temple roof in Tollan.

name: Structure 2 Pyramid, Calakmul
description: Massive multi-terraced Calakmul pyramid with successive royal burials and wide views over the Campeche jungle canopy.

name: La Danta Pyramid
description: One of the largest ancient pyramids by volume, rising from multiple platforms at the Preclassic Maya megasite El Mirador.

name: El Tigre Pyramid
description: Triadic Preclassic pyramid complex with broad staircases and flanking temples anchoring El Mirador's western core.

name: Mundo Perdido Pyramid
description: E-Group astronomical pyramid at Tikal's Lost World complex aligned for solstice and equinox observations.

name: Grand Pyramid, Uxmal
description: Broad unfinished pyramid platform at Uxmal offering commanding views of the Puuc site's decorated palaces.

name: Pyramid of the Niches
description: Seven-tiered El Tajín pyramid famed for its 365 inset niches and once brightly painted plaster surfaces.

name: Pyramid of the Painted Niches
description: Smaller El Tajín pyramid with preserved red and black paint remnants around recessed niches and stairway balustrades.

name: Pyramid of the Plumed Serpents, Xochicalco
description: Decorated platform temple at Xochicalco covered in plumed serpent reliefs and seated rulers.

name: Great Pyramid of Cuicuilco
description: Circular stone pyramid partially buried by lava from the Xitle eruption, representing early Basin of Mexico architecture.

name: South Platform, Monte Albán
description: Stepped platform-pyramid forming the southern anchor of Monte Albán's Great Plaza with sweeping valley vistas.

name: Toniná Acropolis Pyramid
description: Stacked terraces of Toniná's acropolis rise like a pyramid crowned by temples and sculpted monuments.

name: La Iglesia Pyramid
description: Early Cobá pyramid near the site's lakes, featuring steep steps leading to a small temple shrine.

name: Structure 1, Comalcalco
description: Brick-built Maya pyramid at Comalcalco capped by a stuccoed temple on the Gulf Coast plain.

name: Temple 26, Copán
description: Hieroglyphic Stairway pyramid at Copán with inscribed risers recording dynastic history.

name: Structure 33, Yaxchilán
description: Restored pyramid-temple on Yaxchilán's Main Plaza with roof comb sculptures overlooking the Usumacinta River.

name: Temple of Kukulcán at Mayapán
description: Smaller radial pyramid modeled after Chichén Itzá's El Castillo, standing at the center of Mayapán's walled city.

name: Structure 1, Becán
description: Massive pyramid platform at moat-surrounded Becán supporting multiple temple constructions over time.

name: Huaca Pucllana
description: Adobe and clay pyramid built by the Lima culture, featuring stepped platforms and plaza spaces in Miraflores.

name: Huaca La Florida
description: Early mound-pyramid of the Chavín era with superimposed construction phases beneath Lima's modern cityscape.

name: Akapana Pyramid
description: Tiered earthen and stone pyramid central to Tiwanaku with sunken courts and monumental drainage channels.

name: Great Pyramid of Cahuachi
description: Adobe ceremonial pyramid at the Nazca pilgrimage center of Cahuachi near the famous geoglyphs.

name: Huaca Larga at Túcume
description: Extensive Lambayeque adobe pyramid mound stretching over 700 meters within the Túcume complex.

name: Great Pyramid of Caral
description: Main platform mound at the ancient city of Caral, one of the oldest monumental pyramids in the Americas.

name: Gunung Padang Terrace Pyramid
description: Stepped volcanic hill with megalithic terraces interpreted as a prehistoric pyramid on Mount Padang.

name: Candi Sukuh
description: 15th-century Javanese-Hindu temple with truncated pyramid form and erotic relief panels on Mount Lawu's slope.

name: Monte d'Accoddi
description: Step-pyramid altar in Sardinia combining Neolithic platform architecture with a ramped causeway.

name: Pyramid of Falicon
description: Small stone pyramid built above a natural cave near Nice, possibly as an early 19th-century folly or memorial.

name: Pyramid of Tirana
description: Concrete pyramid originally built as a museum for Enver Hoxha, now a repurposed cultural venue in Tirana.

name: Pyramid of Austerlitz
description: Earthen obelisk-like pyramid built by Napoleon's soldiers and topped with an obelisk honoring the Battle of Austerlitz.

name: Pyramid of Bomarzo
description: Rock-cut stepped altar in the woods near Bomarzo resembling a small pyramid with carved stairways and niches.

name: Mausoleum of the First Qin Emperor
description: Burial mound pyramid of Qin Shi Huang, famed for the surrounding Terracotta Army guarding the imperial necropolis.

name: Maoling Mausoleum
description: Huge earthen pyramid tomb of Emperor Wu of Han with accompanying satellite burials and ritual pits.

name: Han Yangling Mausoleum
description: Trapezoidal pyramid mound of Emperor Jing of Han, surrounded by burial pits of terracotta figurines and animals.

name: Duling Mausoleum
description: Earthen pyramid tomb of Emperor Xuan of Han aligned on a north-south axis southeast of Chang'an.

name: Weiling Mausoleum
description: Pyramid mound burial of Emperor Yuan of Han with traces of spirit paths and satellite tombs.

name: Qianling Mausoleum
description: Twin burial pyramid of Emperor Gaozong and Empress Wu Zetian on Mount Liang with processional avenues of stone statuary.

name: Zhaoling Mausoleum
description: Massive earthen pyramid mound of Emperor Taizong of Tang surrounded by dozens of subordinate tombs.

name: Huiling Mausoleum
description: Pyramid mound tomb of Emperor Suzong of Tang, part of the cluster of Tang imperial mausoleums in Shaanxi.

name: Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum
description: Expansive tumulus of the Hongwu Emperor with a spirit way and protective hill forming a pyramid-like burial mound.

name: Dingling Mausoleum
description: Stone-faced mound of the Wanli Emperor at the Ming Tombs, featuring an excavated underground palace.

name: Monks Mound
description: Largest earthen pyramid north of Mexico, composed of four terraces at the center of the Cahokia complex.

name: Mound A, Poverty Point
description: Conical earthwork pyramid at Poverty Point built by hunter-gatherers long before later mound-building cultures.

name: Etowah Temple Mound A
description: Tall earthen platform pyramid at the Etowah site that once supported a chief's temple structure.

name: Emerald Mound
description: Second-largest Mississippian platform mound, forming a low pyramidal plateau with secondary mounds on top.

name: Gebel Barkal Pyramid Field
description: Cluster of small steep pyramids at Gebel Barkal, marking royal burials of the Kushite Napatan kingdom.

name: El-Kurru Pyramids
description: Early Kushite royal pyramid cemetery including burials of Piye and other 25th Dynasty rulers.

name: Sedeinga Queen Pyramids
description: Field of small brick pyramids built for Kushite queens and elites near the temple of Queen Tiye.
